subject: Your daily e-mail from the BBC
body:
Tuesday, 26 June, 2007, 18:00 GMT 14:00 -04:00:Canada/Eastern














Search BBC Sport 













FOOTBALL




Eriksson set to take Man City job
Former England coach Sven-Goran Eriksson agrees a three-year deal in principle to take over at Man City.



 
Eriksson targets Sweden assistant
Sweden's assistant manager, Roland Andersson, says Sven-Goran Eriksson has contacted him about being his number two at Man City.



 
Four resign from Newcastle board
Four of Newcastle's' board members resign, while two new appointments are made.








GOLF




Cabrera set to compete at K Club
US Open champion Angel Cabrera will compete in the European Open at the K Club in Ireland next week.



 
Monty hires Casey's former caddie
Colin Montgomerie is to employ caddie Craig Connolly, who recently split with Paul Casey, for the French Open.



 
Fasth holds on to thwart Langer
Niclas Fasth wins the BMW International Open by two shots from Jose-Filipe Lima and Bernhard Langer.








MOTORSPORT




Dennis should enjoy battle - Hill
Damon Hill says McLaren boss Ron Dennis to sit back and enjoy Lewis
Hamilton and Fernando Alonso's world championship tussle.



 
Stoner scorches to Donington win
Championship leader Casey Stoner produces another dominant display to win the British MotoGP.



 
Ferrari mechanic denies sabotage
Ferrari technical manager Nigel Stepney denies allegations of sabotage made against him by the F1 team.








FORMULA ONE




Dennis should enjoy battle - Hill
Damon Hill says McLaren boss Ron Dennis to sit back and enjoy Lewis
Hamilton and Fernando Alonso's world championship tussle.



 
Ferrari mechanic denies sabotage
Ferrari technical manager Nigel Stepney denies allegations of sabotage made against him by the F1 team.



 
Ferrari wait for 'real Raikkonen'
Ferrari president Luca di Montezemolo says they are still waiting for Kimi Raikkonen to produce his best form.








ATHLETICS




Gay to take on Don Valley clock
This season's fastest man, Tyson Gay, is lined up for the for the Norwich Union Grand Prix in Sheffield.



 
Injury may ruin Powell's $1m bid
Asafa Powell could miss the Golden League meeting in Paris after suffering a groin injury in the 100m at the Jamaican championships.



 
Devonish leads GB to fourth place
Britain's men finish fourth in the European Cup, while the women secure promotion back to the top flight.








CYCLING




Cooke excited by home race return
Nicole Cooke will make a rare appearance on home soil on Wednesday when she competes in the Ras de Cymru.



 
Cavendish can be a star - Museeuw
Belgian cycling great Johan Museeuw believes Mark Cavendish can help take cycling to a wider audience in Britain.



 
Cooke retains Grande Boucle title
Nicole Cooke successfully defends her Grande Boucle Feminine title by winning the 2007 tour in France.








FUN AND GAMES




Quotes of the Week
Thierry Henry is gunning for Barcelona, plus Jose Mourinho gets fruity



 
Teesside tennis
Robbo wonders what would happen if Wimbledon came to the north east



 
Ten to Tackle
How much can you remember about the past week's sport?
